title: Silver and Gold Book cover [01]
creator: University of Idaho Visual Productions
description: Front cover or top lid of object. Engraving of original Administration Building in silver. Encircled by shafts of wheat. Engraving at top reads "Esto Perpetua" or "Let it be perpetual." Engraving at bottom reads "Idaho the Gem of the Mountains." Four corners feature golden reliefs of four important industries in early Idaho history, mining, hunting, timber, and agriculture. Ten rubies and one opal are set along the edges.
subject: decorative art; mining; hunting; farming (activity or system); lumber; jewelry boxes; gold (metal); silver (metal)
source: Silver and Gold Book, President's Office
rights: In copyright, educational use permitted. Educational use includes non-commercial reproduction of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. For other contexts beyond fair use, including digital reproduction, please contact the University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at [libspec@uidaho.edu](mailto:libspec@uidaho.edu). The University of Idaho Library is not liable for any violations of the law by users.

title: Silver and Gold Book standing on edge
creator: University of Idaho Visual Productions
description: Jewelry box is sitting on bottom edge as if it is a book. Edge is styled as a book spine, featuring a silver relief of pine cones, the Idaho state seal (the only state seal designed by a woman), and the dates 1863 (the year Idaho Territory was created) and 1893 (the year of the exposition). Front cover features etching of original Administration Building, gold reliefs of wheat shafts and representations of industries that were important to early Idaho's development.
subject: decorative art; mining; hunting; farming (activity or system); lumber; jewelry boxes; gold (metal); silver (metal)
source: Silver and Gold Book, President's Office

title: Silver and Gold Book edge detail [04]
creator: University of Idaho Visual Productions
description: Close up detail of one long edge of object which appears as the spine of the book. Featuring a golden relief rendering of the state seal of Idaho. The state seal was designed by Emma Edwards Green, the only women to design a state seal in America. The seal includes imagery meant to evoke the foundational characteristics of Idaho.
subject: decorative art; jewelry boxes; gold (metal); silver (metal); Idaho
source: Silver and Gold Book, President's Office
